intro: Teline eriocarpa, commonly known as the woolly teline, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy, glandular leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical heads. Teline eriocarpa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
